intro: Tetrastigma amboinense, commonly known as the Amboina grapevine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by berries. It is often found in humid, tropical environments, growing in forests or on rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
